meanings.definition: To form or develop epithelial tissue.
meanings.sent1: The skin epithelizes to protect our body.
meanings.sent2: The wound epithelizes to heal itself.
meanings.sent3: The cells epithelizing on the surface looked like tiny soldiers lining up for duty.
meanings.sent4: Her determination epithelized into a shield against negativity.
meanings.sent5: The garden of cells epithelized into a beautiful mosaic of protection.

meanings.definition: To undergo the process of epithelialization.
meanings.sent1: After the injury, the skin epithelizes to repair itself.
meanings.sent2: The damaged tissue epithelizes to restore its function.
meanings.sent3: The race between the cells to epithelize the wound was like a tiny marathon.
meanings.sent4: His ideas epithelized into a successful business venture.
meanings.sent5: The city's growth epithelized into a bustling metropolis over time.
